title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) is not being rejected properly.
OB: The report designer allows the user to enter an invalid date string in the default value field of a DateTime type report parameter.
EB: The report designer should validate the date value entered by the user in the default value field of a DateTime type report parameter. If the value is invalid, it should display an error message and prevent the user from saving the design.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a DateTime type report parameter.
4. In the defaultvalue field of the report parameter, enter an invalid date string, such as "55/66/9999".
5. Try to save the design.

Expected result: The designer should display an error message indicating that the date string is invalid and prevent the user from saving the design.
